game.gameObject.physics

Interface Collidable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<GameObject>, GameObject, Movable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BreakOut_Ball, Brick, Pad

    public interface Collidable
extends Movable
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Julius Häger

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int compareTo(GameObject object)
      Used to compare the Z-Order values of two GameObjects.
      java.awt.Rectangle getBounds()
      Returns the GameObject bounds.
      int getMass() 
      int getZOrder()
      Returns the current Z-Order of the GameObject.
      void hasCollided(Collidable collisionObject)
      This method is called when this object has collided with another Collidable object.
      void noLongerColliding(Collidable collidedObject)
      This method is called when this object exits a collision.
      void update(long timeMillis)
      Used to update the movement based on the time passed since the last update.
      void updateBounds()
      Updates the bounds of the GameObject The bounds are used to determine if the GameObjects methods are called.
      void willCollide(Collidable collisionObject)
      This method is called when the next update(long) method call will cause this object to collide with another Collidable object.
      void willNoLongerCollide(Collidable collidedObject)
      This method is called when the next update(long) method call will cause this object to exit a collision.

      • update

        void update(long timeMillis)
        Description copied from interface: Movable

        Used to update the movement based on the time passed since the last update.

        Note:
        Should be implemented so that the Dynamic x and y equal to pixels per second.

        Specified by:
        update in interface Movable
        Parameters:
        timeMillis - time since last update (in milliseconds)

      • willNoLongerCollide

        void willNoLongerCollide(Collidable collidedObject)
        This method is called when the next update(long) method call will cause this object to exit a collision.
        Parameters:
        collidedObject - the Collidable this object will stop colliding with

      • noLongerColliding

        void noLongerColliding(Collidable collidedObject)
        This method is called when this object exits a collision.
        Parameters:
        collidedObject - the Collidable this object is noLongerColliding with.
